p: Common reasons for admission among patients who were eventually discharged included disseminated/advanced KS and severe anemia, whereas the most common reasons for patients who eventually died were severe anemia and sepsis. Advanced HIV disease is in itself a risk factor for developing anemia and/or sepsis. [ 10, 11] In addition, KS has been previously reported to be associated with severe anemia. [ 12] It is therefore not surprising that anemia and sepsis were among the most common reasons for admission.
